contents-list.explanation: someone who has invented something or whose job is to invent things.
samples: Thomas Edison was a great inventor.

contents-list.explanation: a large balloon that is filled with heated air and that floats in the sky with a basket underneath for people to ride in.
samples: A trip in a hot air balloon is amazing.

contents-list.explanation: the cloud of black, gray, or white gases and dust that is produced by burning something.
samples: We could see black smoke from the house fire.

contents-list.explanation: to make something full
samples: May I fill your glass for you?

contents-list.explanation: a smooth, soft, and shiny cloth that is made from thread produced by silkworms.
samples: I want to give my mom a silk scarf.

contents-list.explanation: to do or use something in order to see if it works or will be successful.
samples: He tried a few things to remove the stain, but nothing worked.

contents-list.explanation: something invented.
samples: The light bulb was one of the most important inventions of the 19th century.

contents-list.explanation: a person who is traveling from one place to another in a car, bus, train, ship, airplane, etc., and who is not driving or working on it.
samples: There were two passengers in the car in addition to the driver.

contents-list.explanation: a journey on an airplane.
samples: That will be an overnight flight.

contents-list.explanation: a unit of time equal to 60 seconds.
samples: Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes.

contents-list.explanation: the space or sky that is filled with air.
samples: A bird is flying in the air.

contents-list.explanation: to return to the ground or another surface after a flight.
samples: The plane landed on the runway.

contents-list.explanation: an open area of land without trees or buildings
samples: The green fields are so beautiful.

contents-list.explanation: a person who runs a farm.
samples: My uncle has been a farmer for 60 years.

contents-list.explanation: a usually short journey in or on a vehicle.
samples: He took me for a ride on his motorcycle.

contents-list.explanation: a glass or plastic container that has a narrow neck and usually has no handle.
samples: Shall I open another bottle of wine?

contents-list.explanation: a large vehicle that is used for carrying passengers especially along a particular route at particular times.
samples: I usually go to work by bus.

contents-list.explanation: a vehicle that has wings and an engine and can carry people or things in the air.
samples: We will be traveling to Rome by plane.

contents-list.explanation: a large boat used for traveling long distances over the sea.
samples: A sailing ship disappeared.

contents-list.explanation: a town or city where ships stop to load and unload cargo.
samples: Boston is a major U.S. port.

contents-list.explanation: a place where aircraft land and take off and where there are buildings for passengers to wait in and for aircraft to be sheltered.
samples: We arrived at the airport just in time to catch the plane.

contents-list.explanation: the place where a bus or train regularly stops on a route to let passengers get on and off.
samples: I'm getting off at the next stop.

contents-list.explanation: a flat area next to railroad tracks where people wait for a train or subway.
samples: Our train is boarding on platform 6.

contents-list.explanation: a place where buses, trains, etc., regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off.
samples: They drove him to the bus station.
